column1: Text
每道菜都超好吃 從第一個上的蘿蔔絲餅就讓人驚豔 火焰片皮鴨吃了之後覺得只預訂一隻實在太少了 一整晚下來最可惜的就是沒有多點幾道菜來吃 以後有機會絕對會再訪
片鴨跟甜品風味非常棒 可惜只有兩個人用餐 無法嘗試多樣菜色 下次會邀請多位朋友一起前往頤宮 一起共享美味的餐點
服務真的超好 烤鴨沒有預期中好吃 個人還是偏好北京烤鴨 春風得意腸必點 很厲害 個人也很喜歡脆皮叉燒 非常嫩很好吃

先前聽家人分享有關頤宮的火焰片皮鴨  於是說了一年多總算有時間一起來品嚐  帶著滿心期待的心情走進包廂  眼前的佈置真的令人溫馨又驚艷  因為當天預定了火焰片皮鴨及先知鴨2種主食肉品  服務人員再三提醒對於人數四大三小的我們也許會蠻充足的  真的從訂位確認開始就很貼心  於是現場只點了些點心類的  也剛好點心類的部份都是喜歡的港點  第一道上場當然是火炎片皮鴨  鴨皮部份真的是相當酥脆  搭配爽口解膩的小黃瓜真的很有創意  陸續上了港式點心  點了千層蘿蔔酥  叉燒包等等⋯每一樣  真的每一樣  非常的厲害  明明是頤宮中餐廳  怎麼港點可以這麼厲害  以後港點非頤宮不吃了  席間有專屬的服務人員在裡頭為大家服務  不得不說服務人員非常的有耐心對待小孩  對於小孩發問的各種問題也能溫柔的回答  跟家人聊天時  無意間提到小孩是3月壽星  所以順道帶他出門吃飯當作慶生  沒想到服務人員有聽見我們的談話內容  端出一籠壽桃說招待當月壽星的  整個太貼心了  而且怎麼可以連壽桃都做的這麼好吃  真的是一次非常棒的體驗  不愧是唯一的米其林三星餐廳  期待下次的機會再造訪
已經是第三次到訪  頤宮雖然已榮獲米其林三星多次  但仍不斷持續進步  這次用餐甚至感覺服務人員沒距離很貼心  值得讚許
能夠把食物的原味煮出來  各種食材都非常新鮮  且沒有腥味  真的非常厲害 認為 頤宮 的皮做得非常好吃  包含前菜的 蝦餃  包鴨皮  甜點  印象十分深刻

喜歡美食的我們  蒐集星星為平時的興趣之一此次為兩年內的第三次造訪  加上突然加入的一位友人一同用餐 環境一如往常  此次除了點必點的烤鴨之外  還加點點心與兩道功夫菜菜色符合星級水準  但未若其所獲之頂級標準  許多菜色與其他亦是星級的江浙料理餐廳差不多  未能顯現其獨到之處而人員服務有待加強  對於我們所點菜色間的搭配無法合宜建議  討論  過度  以客為尊  反而可惜了整體菜色的適配性與可口度  建議應致力於身處頂級的  獨孤求敗  精神  更加努力  免得被後起追過
我們是中午12點用餐  但點餐時卻告知多項菜色已經沒有了  明顯備料不足  螃蟹肉質普通會黏在殼上  但有給手套算是貼心  其他的菜色也沒有特別好吃
名副其實  菜色美味  除了需預定的火焰片皮鴨三吃  特製花雕黃皮雞  頤宮叉燒皇外  其他的點心類是更令人驚艷的  特別是鮑魚雞肉燒賣  春風得意腸這二道  除了現場點的茶品很好喝  也會贈送每人一小盒茶包  一樣好喝
月初和朋友到餐廳用餐慶生  吃到令人驚艷的火焰片皮鴨  還有酥脆不會軟掉的春風得意腸  和爆漿的奶黃包  貼心的服務讓用餐很愉快
食物跟服務都精緻  但是好像沒有什麼特別的記點  火焰鴨炫但是沒有特別酥脆  鮑魚燒賣肉質稍硬  小點很一般
原本因為疫情一度想取消訂位  慶幸還是蒞臨了  每桌用餐距離甚遠並有隔板裝潢每一道餐點都精緻美味我不敢吃豬禽類的皮  嘗試了火焰片皮鴨  覺米其林給予君品酒店 - 頤宮中餐廳 Le Palais 三星實至名歸
不愧是米其林三星頂級餐廳  用餐環境相當高級  食材新鮮好吃  服務品質優異  會想帶家人一同品嚐  只是訂位不太容易  價位較高
整體味道很好吃 服務非常到位 片皮鵝完美 鵝粥肉多到吃不完 花雕黃皮雞滿滿花雕香入口花雕味不會過重 乾坤袋是青蛙胃袋 口感很脆都是宮保的味穩穩的 這炸豆腐奶跟奶黃流沙包真的很香很濃 化皮燒乳豬小輸X園的金磚燒肉
整體而言無可挑剔烤鴨很好吃  完全沒有腥味  其他推薦菜色也都完全不踩雷服務品質也很棒  會記住每一位客人的飲食習慣  也會隨時注意賓客用餐進度  來幫大家更換盤子已經添加茶水  是值得一去的店
此次受到大家好評的食物  主要都是小點類  蘿蔔絲餅  蔥油餅  鱈魚香絲避風塘  炸豆奶 火焰片皮鴨倒是普通  海鮮豆腐煲還不錯  麻辣跳跳雞口味頗有趣
從進餐廳開始到用餐所有環節都非常滿意  每一餐點都令人讚嘆  不愧為唯一米其林三星餐廳  是會再去的餐廳也會介紹給親朋好友
非常好吃的粵菜餐廳  欣賞火焰片皮鴨作法就是一種享受  每一道餐點都非常的好吃  但可惜有一些餐點像烤乳豬都要先預訂  只能等待下一次再品嚐  唯一比較不習慣較昏暗的燈光  如果可以調整 個人會覺得更非常值得拜訪的餐廳好

初次體驗頤宮  整體可說美味  粵式小點及中式料理都以高級且新鮮的食材呈現  但是以自身體驗過數間國外米其林三星餐廳的經驗  頤宮的環境氣氛滿好的  但是食物味道層次  視覺擺盤  整體精緻度仍不足  桌邊服務不差但也不算細膩  因此個人覺得很難算是三星餐廳  最多列入2.5顆星  比二星再好一些   綜合上述  便會覺得食物定價都太高  這些純屬個人感受  非恣意批評  但說實話的確仍有加強空間  台灣有米其林三星餐廳是十分榮耀且不易  所以期待也特別高  因此說出個人真實感受與觀點  相信頤宮未來能繼續成長  在三星餐廳中屹立不搖  更上層樓
餐廳本身氣氛很好  裝潢也很華麗  服務也很周到  在此用餐確實感受到尊榮感  火焰片皮鴨不錯吃  但不如想像中驚艷  不曉得是不是第三吃選擇鴨粥的關係  大部分的鴨肉都拿去煮粥了  有點吃不太過癮  鴨肉粥本身味道很好  但鴨肉煮粥口感變柴  較沒有直接切片吃來的有口感  餐點好吃但價格偏高  之後一定要來點他們的三星套餐
本次消費體驗相當良好  入場即有專人朗誦屬於頤宮的詩句  讓用餐環境更具詩情畫意  點餐時用心為客人推薦適合自己的菜色  也仔細介紹食用方法  讓客人能進入料理中遨遊  更專注在味蕾上  品味廚師的好手藝
這次是這一季第三次拜訪  除了烤鴨以外 菜單全部換新 真的如心中期望 不需此行 也值得一去再去的好地方 餐點仍然到位
當天中午前往用餐  朋友點兩道菜  兩道的說今天沒有供應  覺得莫名  鴨三吃很普通  鴨粥煮太爛  烤鴨捲皮太厚吃不到肉  烤鴨就一般般  唯一結論能點的是港點和點心另外廁所的部份也讓人無法覺得有三星水準  免治馬桶遙控器和馬桶本身脫鉤  廁所設備品牌不統一  馬桶更換過椅座色差很大  讓人懷疑這真的有三星的品質嗎
火焰片鴨真的超乎預期的美味  服務人員都很美麗親切  不愧是三星美食  壽星還招待超可愛的小壽桃  超級圓滿的慶生餐
服務態度非常的好  食物也很驚豔  一定要給自己一個機會來吃看看  餐廳的裝潢也是一大特色  室內擺設的植物全部都是真的  並非什麼假花假樹  花費許多心力照顧這些植栽  牆上的壁畫有些也是人工繪製而成並不是壁貼  真讓人嘆為觀止
餐點好吃  胃袋和龍筋餐點很特別  服務態度也很好  整體品質很對的起價格下次還會到貴店用餐體驗其他餐點和良好的服務品質
一進門就有熱心的服務人員引導入座  春風得意腸  鮑魚燒賣相當好吃  先知鴨不錯但是一隻2980真的蠻貴的  整體來說相當不錯  會再訪
經過米其林的三星認證的餐廳  口味環境及服務鐵定沒什麼好批評費用來講  若不點大菜  其實總價都還能接受  期望未來還有機會造訪
餐點好吃  但火片鴨的鴨翅不在湯裡也未在餐宴中  不知烤鴨翅跑到那裏去了  在餐宴中也未咨詢我們鴨翅是否須要  反正就不見於餐宴中
因對火焰鴨鴨期待太高失望太大  所以由春風得意腸拔得頭籌  當然服務是好的另外招牌馬拉糕也是不錯的  甜香軟並俱
服務人員會依照現場客戶需求  提供所需要的餐點份數及分割服務  非常棒  另外也貼心的提供餐後甜點供客戶享用  甜點也是手作  很有誠意
食材口味環境良好優質非常推薦  服務很貼心  建議大家一定要預約烤鴨好吃又非常實惠  無可挑惕  只可惜座位太少預約很難排
位在都市鬧區所以必須先提早出門  但是是很用心與精緻的料理  環境氛圍相當棒  如果預算許可  確實值得在人生中前往吃一次
此次用餐目的為生日餐聚  品嘗過程中服務人員細心介紹餐點並適時給予建議  盡力滿足座上賓的需求  餐點部分則無可挑剔  無一不令人吮指回味
火焰片皮鴨  頤宮叉燒皇  陳醋五花骨真的很讚  普洱茶也滿不錯  但室內光線較暗了些  另外可惜慶生驚喜被服務人員戳破
不愧是米其林評選三星餐廳  從入門的接待座位的安排都可見店家的用心  服務人員親切的接待與解說每道美食料理  讓色香味俱全的美味  入口充滿層次變化  用餐的節奏也可以因應顧客的需求安排  當天還特地準備新鮮水果塔祝福我們結婚週年快樂  對於頤宮超級滿意
餐點好吃  特別  招牌的先知鴨肉質軟嫩  特別是鴨骨熬製成的粥  綿密順口非常香濃  服務人員也非常熱心  會一直留意是否有需要服務的地方
有一位服務生很貼心的發現我們想拍照  就主動詢問要幫我們拍照  以及跟三星旗子合照  但忘記看他的名片了  謝謝她了
用餐環境美  服務態度好  佳餚口味棒  選擇更多元  好茶配美食  聚餐好場所  期待著下次再度造訪這間米其林推薦的好餐廳

服務非常周到  工作人員詢問我們的酒何時要上桌因為現在剛下冰桶還沒有很冰  告知上雞料理時上非常準時都不用再提醒  食物美味且細心陳列餐後工作人員詢問酒喝完了是否要再來  因為喝的這隻自備酒對我們來說非常有紀念價值故告知想要留下瓶子做紀念  工作人員問是否要將軟木塞也留下  我說好  但似乎在開瓶時就已經丟了  所以工作人員主動提供免去開瓶費的部分 唯一美中不足的地方是男廁便斗前的尿漬非常明顯  所以整體給95分
食物的精緻度及美味超乎預期  師傅的刀功細膩純熟  服務更是優質  特別感謝Eva貼心的服務及詳細的解說  讓這次的用餐體驗畫下完美句點
料理比預期中好片皮鴨和叉燒皇的食材有用心挑選  接待區拍照服務人員很專業及貼心  餐桌服務人員服務態度雖好  但經驗和察覺力不夠   上菜未觀察客人正在談話  常打斷  常沒留意到客人需要換盤子了
席間耐心介紹菜單  我們預算沒有很多  也貼心給予點菜建議  洋甘菊茶很好喝  喜歡喝香氣濃的建議可點  奶油流沙包鹹蛋黃大推那好吃
這是一間非常棒的餐廳  這是我們第二次來這次吃到了火焰鴨  非常好吃  令人感動  服務非常的好  非常親切  還會幫忙拍照謝謝你們  謝謝
非常感謝頤宮中餐廳給了我們這麼好的聚餐體驗  東西都非常精緻好吃  最有趣的應該就是  因為餐點很暗  然後如果要合照的話  服務生會幫忙打光
美味的火焰鴨搭配腸粉和鴨粥  叉燒皇炸豆腐奶也不錯  是值得一點的美食服務到位氣氛很棒推薦給中式美食饕客享用
招牌的先知鴨皮很乾  味道也不特別美味  cp值很低雞火豆腐絲則刀功厲害且味美點心類也不錯服務人員態度佳  可惜餐廳的空調太強  在冷風不斷吹送之下  不僅客人越做越冷  食物也很快涼掉而影響食物的口感及味道餐廳僅不斷叮嚀服裝注意事項  卻忽略舒適環境的控管  鄰桌客人大聲說話  讓餐廳的格調變差以米其林的價位吃不到對等的美食  殊為可惜

餐點的精緻與細緻  令我們感覺很滿意港式點心的爽口  細緻和食材的處理  讓我們喜歡  叉燒皇  脆皮乳豬  我們驚艷主廚的廚藝展現  藝術等級的處理食材  火焰片皮鴨的三吃  恰到好處  每道可口滿意而海鮮豆腐煲則較顯一般  海鮮用料實在  但可能砂鍋熱度高  湯汁燒得較乾  開蓋拌鍋時  略顯焦味  鮮度反而顯現不出  略失所望  服務佳  體貼周到  感受很好  環境佈置用心中式餐廳加上中式佈置  有濃濃的中式風  因為近聖誕節  加上聖誕佈置有些突兀如果  走自己的中式風格  強調中式節氣與時令  或許也能獨樹一格
很棒的用餐體驗  餐廳服務很好東西也好吃  不過米其林三星價格還是偏高  如果可以搭配一些訂位折扣會更好  有機會還會去吃  試試看不一樣的餐點
服務真的好  每道菜都講解得非常清楚  詢問食材或是味道都能得到完整答覆  離開拍照還幫打燈  茶特別好喝  餐點都是水準之上  但三星太沈重  每道菜你都覺得好吃  但心目中一定有另一家更好吃的店  價位偏中上
服務整體來說算是很棒  唯當天晚上的火焰烤鴨讓人大失所望  感覺米其林三星給得很奇怪  鴨肉烤得太材太乾了  完全沒有感謝到好吃  至於其它點心倒是做得不錯也非常好吃  謝謝
燈光美  氣氛佳  服務人員很細心  食物也很美味因為只有兩人用餐  有些食物份量可供調整  例如港點一份三個  可以改成兩個  這點很貼心
服務貼心細緻而且不擾人 對菜色的解釋詳細專業 環境佳 每道菜都有其特色 而且讓人驚豔 唯一的不足是筍殼魚使用的花椒 搶走了魚本身的鮮味
本來以為三星的餐廳會多麼高級  但其實服務一班  食物一般  整體就是一般而已帶長輩去吃飯是想要慶祝家裡的大事  結果覺得好像還好
服務品質相當好  每一道菜均更換餐具  更顯賓客尊榮  宴請友人  主人相當有面子  菜餚口味濃淡適中  擺盤精緻  用料實在  食材非常新鮮  米其林三星當之無愧

頤宮的先知鴨  NT.2980  有多招牌已經不用多說  近兩年才推出的火焰片皮鴨  NT.3980  到底值得吃嗎  火焰片皮鴨上桌前在桌邊淋上竹葉青酒  之前是君度橙酒  再點火快烤數十秒  視覺上是很驚奇  但仍不免懷疑只是噱頭  實際一吃  正因為桌邊這一烤  未上桌就可以聞到皮下油脂散溢出來的香氣  咬下表皮的脆度讓人愉快  油汁與肉因熱度送進嘴裡都還是香的  先知鴨在肉質嫩度上略勝火焰片皮鴨  但必須把握上桌的黃金賞味期享用  兩種鴨各有吃點  難以割愛  建議八人以上用餐  兩者都點  另外推薦叉燒  除了菜單上鼎鼎有名的  頤宮叉燒皇   NT.1680   另有一道隱藏菜色  脆皮叉燒   NT.1180   一樣是要是先預訂的菜色  前者柔嫩程度僅此一家  但後者的脆又計高一籌  搭配檸檬口感更讓尋常燒臘的境界提升幾層這兩道也建議同時點來品嚐比較

I have had 3 3 stars Michelin star meals so far in my life  a French cuisine at epicure in Paris  a Japanese cuisine at sukiyabashi jiro in Tokyo  and now  a Chinese cuisine at Le Palais in Taipei. I confidently declare this was the best 3 star meal I ve ever had. It lives up to its name  price  and hype.After I made a reservation  I researched its repertoire of dishes  and discussed with the restaurant staff. The staff relentlessly worked with me and created a one of a kind 8 course set menu that was within my budget.The first dish was the suckling roast pig. It was the only dish I wasn t blown away by  but nonetheless tasted great. What makes this dish unique is they remove all the fat of the pig  and reassemble the lean meat and crispy skin into a single bite. However  I felt it could have used a little bit of fat to make it more layered in texture and flavor.Not shown in the attached menu was the second dish  the prophet duck. It is named after some Chinese poem that I don t have much appreciations of  and it was a bit awkward when the server recited the poem to us. However  this was one of the best ducks I ve ever had the pleasure to indulge in my life  rivals the ones from the NYC Peking duck house and Orlando s morimoto Asia. Unique to this restaurant  this particular duck is less than 1 month old  making it extremely tender. The fat content is just right  slightly on the low side  but doesn t feel dry. The duck is cut into bite size pieces and enjoyed as is  maximizing it s original flavors without additional condiments  enabling one to truly enjoy the pure taste of a high quality roasted duck.The 3rd dish was the fish maw chicken soup. The soup was very thick  as a result of hard boiling brown rice into its stock  using old hens. The fish maw was well flavored  signaling the chef s skill with such a difficult ingredient to work with. The flavor of the soup blew me away  it had multiple layers of scent and flavor that is difficult to describe  an experience that is quite unforgettable.The 4th dish followed the soup was a beautifully presented  winter melon hat  . The winter melon is meticulously shaped into a perfect circle  with a thick  rendered chicken and duck stock within the plate. Upon cutting it open  I found within a generous serving of crabs  scallops  and duck meat stuffed inside the melon. Although all courses from tonight were skillful kung-fu dishes  I found this particular dish a true testament of the chef s amazing culinary skills. Needless to say  the aroma  and flavor of this dish is simple in its own class.The next dish is the steamed dragon-tiger grouper. Simply put  this is the best fish dish I have ever enjoyed in my life. The balance of the unique soy sauce blend and the Sichuan peppercorn created a flavor symphony in my mouth  and was simply a delight to enjoy.The second course of the prophet duck came on as the 6th course of the meal. It was prepared in the famous hongkong typhoon shelter style  a flavor style often used in crabs and lobsters  but it is a first for me to be done on a duck. Moreover  the way it is done is also unique  the fried batter was extremely thin  with a beautiful red coating. The savory flavor was just right  not overpowering the flavor of the duck. The prophet duck is a signature dish at the restaurant and I can see why that is.Onto the 7th course as we reach closer to the end of the meal is a unique scallion cake. Differ from traditional scallion cake  the way it is done here is closer to a stuffed meat cake in Taiwan  where an abundant of yilan 3 star onion and shrimp is stuffed into a light  chewy yet crunchy crust  altering my understanding of what a scallion cake is capable of tasting like. This is the best scallion cake I have ever had in my life.Finally  the dessert is a double cheese pastry shelled in a fluffy  powder sugar coated crust. This was the perfect way to end the meal  and was fantastic tasting in every possible way.Le Palais lives up to the 3 star Michelin motto  that it is worth to plan a trip just to dine at this restaurant. Every dish was in its own class  and although it is extremely expensive  I would consider to return to the restaurant again simply because of its amazing meal.

Went here recently for a lunch with a bunch of friends. We pre-ordered the duck and roasted pork ahead of time to ensure we d get their signature items. We had very high expectations coming in given that this restaurant has received 3 Michelin Stars  what a let down this was.Having dined at numerous Michelin starred restaurants around the world and in Taipei - I have to wonder if we just went on an off day because the meal was entirely underwhelming  bland and disappointing and nowhere near what I would expect from a 3 star establishment and for the price we paid.The highlight of the meal was the duck which they light on fire and carve in front of you. The rolled up pieces of duck were tasty and had good flavor  skin was nice and crispy and the meat was moist and juicy at that point. This was indeed the highlight of the meal.The duck leg pieces they served after that though were dry and not flavorful though the plum sauce was nice. We opted for the duck porridge over the soup for the third preparation which had a nice texture but was bland and underwhelming and needed seasoning. Adding some of the plum sauce made the dish better and more palatable.The final preparation of the duck was duck meat stir fried with some vegetables. The duck was dry and flavorless and reminiscent of something you d find in a rechao spot in Taipei. In my opinion  if you get 3 Michelin stars you need to elevate the basics like stir fried meat and vegetables to a whole different level  that didn t happen here and the consensus at the table was this was a very basic dish that doesn t reflect well on a 3 Michelin star establishment.We also had the roasted pork which was juicy and tender and very lean  but lacked any depth of flavor and what you d expect with a char siu / bbq roasted pork.The char siu bao s were good -though pricey- and the spinach and salted egg dumpling was unique and nice and besides the first preparation of the duck were probably the other standouts of the meal.Ambience is nice and service is attentive  friendly and efficient. But for nearly 3  000 NT$ a person and with 3 Michelin stars to its name  we expected a whole lot more and were incredibly surprised just how basic it was and how bland the flavors were. We left wondering if we just happened to go on an off day  but the consensus amongst everyone at the table was that it was a very underwhelming meal and not worth the price paid  nor reflective of the expectations one has of a 3 Michelin star establishment.

At Le Palais de Chine  the explosion of broth perfectly matched in each concoction was truly wonderful. We especially enjoyed the crispy baby duck  lobster in ginger & scallion and the 虾饺. The steaming 大禹嶺 was a perfect match to cleanse our palates after each dish   we had a wonderful time and we’ll definitely be back to try the other dishes  我们去品尝很多不同国家的米其林三星-一星的餐厅  这里真是三星给得最准确了❤️每道菜都含有材料的原汁风味  独特的魅力依依显出今天吃得好陶醉的是脆皮鸭  龙虾和虾饺加上想着苏轼的诗  鸭子的原味吃到心里也点对了大禹嶺乌龙茶  一口一口吃喝入味谢谢大厨和各位服务人员  我们会再次去品尝其他菜式好期待💕

Duck was incredible and definitely the most memorable dish of the night. The rest of the food were all high quality but just good for Michelin 3-star. The dim sum for example  is not going to impress like  The 8  in Macau does and you can get similar quality for cheaper elsewhere.Service and atmosphere were exceptional. Extravagant decor while still managing to offer a comfortable dining experience.Price is definitely on the cheaper side for Michelin 3-star. There are some ridiculously expensive items on the menu like bird s nest  but you can expect a good meal for 2.5  3K NTD per person.Overall  a great experience that s worth the trip  although I feel if you opened the same restaurant in HK or Macau it probably would ve got a 1 or 2 star from Michelin.

I visited quite a couple of times and there are 3 must ordered dishes. Bbq pork is definitely the best. The muscle tenderness is perfect and maintain a right balance of honey  bbq sauce and the taste of pork. The second dish is a thousand year egg veggie dumpling. This is a kind of dish that only offer here. The color of veggie is covered by a transparent skin. The 3rd one is the deep fried radish pastry. The salty ham amplified the white radish freshness and sweetness. Usually deep fried is equivalent to oily but the chef managed it super well  . which is hot but dried  feel like it is baked rather than deep fried. The choice of wine and tea is hugh. The services  is beyond the Taiwanese standard. And no doubt it clinched the Michelin 3 star. Must visit spot for foodie

Went for New Year s celebration with family  so we were able to see all the varieties of main on our table. The pasta was cooked too soft and the beef my brother ordered was way over-cooked. I would skip the main and simply go for the salad bar which is fulfilling enough.
Food and service was good. We enjoyed the meal and the experience of eating at a good restaurant. Reservation was fairly easy too.

Visited this place as it is considered the best Chinese restaurant in Taiwan. As coming as a couple  we ordered the BBQ pork set menu so that we can taste many dishes as opposed to ordering ala carte. The highlight was the BBQ pork which is one of the best I ever had. The set menu is mostly traditional Chinese dishes with some modern touches. Some of the dishes were a little difficult to comprehend  e.g. mala infused goby fish steamed in soy sauce    but the overall experience was positive. Good service for international clients.Restaurant was very beautiful  and it was more casual inside than many other *** places I ve eaten at.

This was my first time dining at a Michelin 3-star restaurant. I ordered the most popular cuisine such as crispy roast duck  barbecue pork  and fried chicken. The taste for me was not uncommon but  in deed  they were very delicate and delicious. I am not the guy who knows the Michelin stars  but I am an ordinary person who likes to eat different famous dishes. What attracted me was the duck course flame show  which was prepared by the chef at your table. Next time  I will order the set menu to see what different inside

This was my first three Micheline Star restaurant ever and it did not dissappoint at all. Everydish was excellent. The baby duck was excellent  the bbq pork were memorable. The shrimp tempura rolls were also excellent. The pepper sponge cake was uniquely simple and delicious. we also had the lotus seed baoand they were a very positive surprise. The service and ambiance were both top-notch.

If you ask me how Gustoso restaurant is  I would say that it got Nice atmosphere and Excellent service. The manager Andy is a super nice host who can make the customers enjoy the meals just like home. serve you with good food and chat with you we warming greetings. When you look out from the window pane  you may see the beautiful streets which are famous because of the sea of flowers and trees aside. Of course  the food is delicious and delicate as well. Scenes they serve semi buffet  there are plenty of home made side dishes and dessert. My favorite main dish is the roast fish with zucchini  green pepper  and baby corns. The prize is from $700 to $2000. You may taste the diversity of the food according to your own favor. My family and I will definitely recommend this fancy restaurant to all our friends in the near future. Come visit and experience the amazing attraction of this place. You were not only be able to fill your starving stomach  but also fill your hungry heart.
As always the food is amazing  Fresh cooked  Fresh ingredientsQuality is upheld greatlyAmazed and grateful for the meal

I ordered roasted duck with flame. I found that the duck meat was not tender at all. I suspected that the duck was roasted before  frozen  and re-roasted again. The duck apparently was not freshly cooked. I tried to call the restaurant about this  but the phone never got connected to anyone.

Two person set menu was ordered from EZtable with very little info about what the actual menu is. I misguidedly believed that a Michelin 3-star restaurant would not disappoint us with its food  but we were sorely dismayed by the cuisines presented. While the food seemed to be prepared to a high level of skill  it was often bland and at times bizarre  i.e. the fish course was aimed at numbing the palate  for some unknown reason  . The few exceptional dishes could not salvage the overall experience--as some of the dishes were not just unsavory  but almost unpalatable.

I organized a fast business trip in Taipei and booked a room at Palais de Chine just a few hours before landing in Taiwan.I travel for business not for leisure and I need to rely on top service  I can tell Palais de Chine has been for me an amazing hotel experience  far better than many famous branded hotel I experienced in Asia. All is perfect in this hotel. I checked in very late at night as my flight was delayed  At my arrival at hotel I was received like a superstar  I was given a very efficent check in and I was offered a complimentary snacks in my room  a plate of fresh fruit which I really appreciated. The staff of reception is very professional and kind and I liked so much their approach to me  professional but friendly. The hotel interior design itself is worth of a visit  the interion designers made a great job and created an atmosphere that reminded me of a real “ Palace” . The Palace experience comes  to a full fruition during the breakfast  the most amazing breakfast of all 2019 so far  I travel an average of 150 days per year and spend about 150 nights out in 5 stars hotel  well I can rate the breakfast of the Palais de Chine as the best ever in 2019  the food experience is amazing the quality is outstsnding  the service is perfect  I want to repeat the experience as I was so  deighted with the food variety and quality     I should spend a word also for the room  so quite and clean  with no dust in the corners  a fantastic bedkinen set in pure Egyptian cotton allowed me a perfect rest. it is really very very rare to reach this level of perfection  but this hotel is perfect in all areas that are important for a business man  reception  concierge  food and beverage  and room too. I had a fantastic time in Palais de Chine and I will come back 200% when im Taipei. Last but not least  this is a real top 5 star hotel by all means but they charge a very reasonable rate if compared with the product and service they offer

I recently visited Taipei and wanted to experience Le Palais. Booking the restaurant wasn t difficult as I did a bit of research and was able to book the very first day I was able to. A few days before visiting the restaurant  I called in to to pre-order the baby duck.  Getting to the restaurant via the underground passages around Taipei main station was a bit difficult and confusing  but the detailed maps on the website helped tremendously.  The food at the restaurant was superb. We arrived during lunch so we had many of the dim sum options and the baby duck. Both were fantastic  but if I had to go back  I d order more of the dim sum dishes.  The service was excellent. Helpful  but not intrusive and annoying.  The atmosphere was private and conducive for conversation.  Overall  Le Palais met my expectations and I hope to return in the future.

I ordered michelin three stars course. Foods were really great and tasty  but the amount was a bit too much  for me  at least  .. After fifths course  I was tooo full to enjoy having great foods. Still  it was good though. Atmosphere was good and in particular staffs were really nice.
This is my first try something new like eating in 3 michellin star awarded. Its was great experience in my life. The foods  the services  and the ambiance  Thank you

Le Palais was definitely the best Chinese I ever had so far. The 28 days old roasted baby duck was an ala carte order-3 days in advanced. Lightly marinated with chinese herb- super crunchy outside yet the meat is extremely tender. The rack and the left over meat can be done in 3 ways- boiled with sour soup  cooked with porridge or stir fried with salt and pepper.  The tasting menu in another hand came with some surprise and some dishes was kinda let down. Personally I like the fish maw soup the most follow by wok fried noodle- nicely done without any oil. The abalone and the asparagus with crab meat was not memorable- not bad but just far from my expectation from a 3 stars Michelin restaurant.  The service was flawless once I stepped out from the lift  being guided by the hostess all the way to the washroom before proceed to a semi-private 4 seaters dining area. Service staff were also well-trained in the description and taste profiles of every item in the menu  and introduced the dishes in the most poetic and soothing way.  While it is said that Michelin inspectors judge based on just the taste alone  I truly believe part of the reason why Le Palais works is due to its opulent décor. The ambience is so remarkable- with the best decorative material being applied and some very pretty cultural/traditional vintage pieces being displayed. The ambience is a bit dark and dim but in a good way-the central of each dining table stand out as a showcase.  I am a typical Chinese uncle and I am so in love with Chinese food as I grow older and wiser. However  this was my very first attempt dining at 3 starred Chinese’. Will I come back- oh definitely YES. For the sake of the ROASTED BABY DUCK  or perhaps I will try the roasted pork next trip  as well as the DIM SUM.  Overall  8.5/10.

Convenient transportation and excellent service. There is ample space between the tables  and the decor is classic and elegant.The baked barbecue pork buns was the best I had ever had  all other dishes were delicious too.We had honey BBQ pork  Prophet Duck  classic steamed king prawn dumplings  baked BBQ pork buns  chicken and lard dumplings top with abalone and salted egg yolk custard buns.. The chef first slice the meat from roasted duck  then made the congee  porridge  with the bones. The duck bones base congee was so delicious that I had second bowl of it.
Nice decor  great service  and of course the delicious foods  like the crispy ducks and it’s desserts.Surely come again next time

Celebrated birthday at this hotel s lovely and lively restaurant with superb French ambience. The steak and dessert were delicious  and service was outstanding. It s not a weekend but surprisingly the restaurant was full

Our family likes to make a trip for around a week each time we stay at Palais de Hotel for celebration  this time is for my 9 years baptism anniversary  We spent most of our meals inside the hotel because it has such great quality and services and we also enjoyed the 17 floor VIP lounge and the gym  Every since the General Manager Mr.Garavaglia Licinio from Italy managed this hotel from last year  we can see great improvement in different area. Our family is very delighted to see him and chat with him during our stay. His sincerity  kindness  concern and enthusiastic just make you feel like you are staying at your second home

As I was feeling a little upset there they saw me and gave me napkins hahahaha so emotional but then I was okay and their tea was great the bbq pork chop and shrimp was great and also they have little tea bags gift after the meal  The plates constantly changing and people guide u to the washroom  Full service  And even I’m from HK I love their dim sum  Even though quite pricy in general compare to HK hotel prices
I was overwhelmed by the wonderful food.  It is a pleasant restaurant with a good atmosphere.  I want to come back again.

3 friends and I heard wonderful things about Le Palais and we had never been to a restaurant of this caliber so we thought we would try it. We were visiting Taipei from the U.S. so we made reservations online. We decided to try the set meal  $2980  . From the first course we were blown away. Each and every course was amazing and even the items that I am not especially fond of  radish pastry  I was blown away by. I was stuffed by the last two courses but still ate everything because it tasted so good even though I was completely full already. The ambiance was also amazing. The dining room was beautifully decorated  the bathrooms were gorgeous and clean. Everything was impeccable. We ordered tea on top of our set meal and the tea was delicious too. Service was over the top. My tea cup was never empty nor cold. I will be back this summer and plan to make another trip to Le Palais at that time

We had a family lunch there trying to experience what a Michelin three stars restaurant feel like. We were not disappointed at all. The atmosphere was great  a bit dark for reading the menu    the service was excellent and the food was the best. We enjoyed a lot with a reasonable price. Highly recommended

服務非常周到  連照相還有打燈令人印象深刻  先知鴨油到發亮的酥皮  一上桌就讓人眼睛一亮  片皮的過程還是錄影了  環境優雅氣氛上乘  大菜巧奪天工  港點精緻可口  曾經被長輩招待過一次全素菜  在圓桌的包廂中  菜餚豐富美味  賓主盡歡  絕對讓招待方面子裡子都具足的選擇  Attentive service. The service manager even help lighten when you take group photos which makes everyone looks great. The duck is a must-try dish. Different from the traditional Peking Duck but with the little duck born only for a month  which make the texture tender. Their DimSim is one of the best in town. I was once invited into the VIP room served with all vegetarian dishes. no let down. Highly recommend for anyone who would like to impress their guests.

The food  decor and service are top notch. It is definitely worth the trip alone for the experience. I ordered set menus and other guests order a la carte. I was content with the set menu but more impressed with the dim sum items. You can taste the freshness of the ingredients and the skills of the chefs. We are definitely coming back if we ever visit Taipei again.

One of the best meals I have experienced in Asia. Decor & service are top notch. Crispy Chicken was divine  I also enjoyed the birds nest soup  my first time trying this dish  . Wagyu beef melted in our mouths.
It was a very pleasant dining experience. The service was spot on as well as the food and environment.

The setting couldn t have been better. We had a private room with an expensive view 9f the city and its own private restroom. We ordered a mixture of dishes including dim sum  and every dish was outstanding. Our server Miffy was attentive and helpful in describing the dishes and offering good suggestions. We have benn to Taiwan many times  and this was among the best meals ever. We will definitely go back next time we are in Taipei.
The service provided by staff was hands down the best I have experienced in Taipei. Highly recommend ordering the duck  Fairly priced for a Michelin 3 Star restaurant nestled inside a 5 star hotel.
要點菜時問了3次以上說要點菜服務生都說她不能點要找其他人來過很久才找一個男士來點菜我不知道為什麼這麼多服務生都不能點餐嗎  Asked for more than three times  Finally can order dishes.

I would say the set menu has really low value and my biggest disappointment is that some of the most famous items were not included in the set menu. When I was booking online  there was no information on what will be included in the set menu and I made a bad assumption of thinking they will have the famous fire duck in the restaurant week menu.For some of the popular items  keep in mind that you will need to make request of two or three days ahead.Overall  I would never go bad for tasting menu  even the ones in the end of the menu do not look good  I would suggest to go with few friends and order their dim sum and 燒臘 to share across the group.

I visited Taipei in May  and this hotel made the experience unforgettable.  Amazing service from the check-in to the lounge to dinner.  The room decor was classy and handy made navigating the city without a sim super convenient   he new GM at the time made a great impression.  Looking forward to coming back the next time in Taiwan.

Went as a party of two and pre-ordered the crispy roast baby duck  which we were told was for 3-4 pax although we found the serving to be just right for us. It is served two ways and we chose Wok-fried for the second portion. Had some rice with it as well. Duck was excellent  do follow the recommendation of the restaurant  to eat it plain first then try with some lemon or salt and pepper  although personally the plain was still best.  We also tried the muscle scallops and the barbecue pork buns  which we liked a lot. Order is per piece. They even served free ice cream upon exiting the restaurant.  Service was excellent and servers were friendly and very attentive in changing plates and refilling our glasses of water and wine. They spoke decent English.  Very happy with our reservation here  worth going for the duck alone.
Fantastic food  great service  had a dinner in private room. Exquisite well deserved of Michelin  rating. If you have the money and can get a booking  you will have the best time in your life here

I visited here with my mom. Waitresses tried to be friendly  but I don t think so.  Also I was dissatisfied with the quality of food. We ordered king prawn dumpling  puff pastry dumpling with radish  Barbecue pork  and Abalone with sea cucumber. I don t know why but radish dumpling tastes fishy and texture of abalone was bad. I think they use canned abalone because I felt unpleasant salty tastes when I bite this.  Not only that  my mom and I wanted to have some conversation but waitress took all the dishes right after we finished last one so I felt like they want me to leave quick even if we spent only 40 minutes there.  It was 8 p.m when we finished our dining

Very good experience for my first stay here. Unique decor  comfortable room  polite and helpful staff. View of the city was very good from my upper floor. Of special note is Ken & Yvonne at the desk near the main door. Tirelessly answered all of mine and my wife s questions about getting around the city and seeing various attractions. The hotel is conveniently located as well.

And nearly fun as it is such a strange place. All is clean. All is luxurious. Style is old palace while the building is quite modern. Food os quite good. Service quite professional. Rooms are nive and big even though to somber by my taste.  If u r there on business the hotel has all what u need including a very cool system of local mobile phones linked to ur room to reduce the call charges.  Definitely gives u a break from the classical business hotel.
Location of the restaurant is very convenient. Food was delicious.  Service was nice.  Recommend to visit if you come to Taipei.

I had dinner here whilst staying at the hotel on business and whilst the seafood buffet and sushi bar were well presented I found the service for the table I was on - with colleagues - to be indifferent at best and certainly not what you might expect from the experience I had had of the rest of the hotel attitude  which was universally excellent in terms of service. For example  we had ordered a main course from the menu and indicated that we were going to have buffet seafood starters including sushi but very quickly  before we had even got back to our table from the sushi bar  our main courses started to arrive. Being the hot main course  we faced with either letting them go cold or switching the order of eating. All in all  most restaurants manage to organise main courses by observing when diners are finishing their starters but clearly that was too much hassle here. Our waiter could not have cared less  either. Dump the plates and shrug seemed to be his approach. In terms of food  it was actually fine  and the seafood especially good  but I would not go out of my way to eat there again.

Location  Strategically located at transport hub of Taipei where the subway central bus station High Speed Rail  HSR  and TRA all come together affording great convenience and time/cost savings. We went to Taichung and back with seamless connections and just walked back to PDC all quite effortlessly at end of trip.  Staff  Words fail me in attributing highest accolades to a team that s eager to please and always available to offer assistance without being intrusive. Every member of the staff from the moment you step into the lobby  from basement car garage or the street level lobby  or into elevator & just about everywhere will greet you readily with a smile and offer to assist pro-actively. Their sincere humble and heartfelt desire to make your stay an unforgettable experience is felt keenly and certainly resonates with hotel guests. Examples include the staff who wanted to accompany me to the room in case my husband doesn t hear the doorbell ring  I needed help to access my floor not having my keycard with me  . The restaurant  Shin Yeh-highly recommended  booking which was done expediently with name/address written down for us  just in case  though they had already arranged taxi driver to bring us there. This is Asian hospitality at its bestest especially for the reasonable room rates.  Decor  The Japanese-style toilet bidet is a treat  Rooms are tastefullymodern/minimalist and we especially love the fact that night lights come on automatically when master switch is switched off. Privacy may be an issue if you re not a couple due to the open concept bathroom.  Gym  Cosy feels like home gym  They showed my husband how to use the USD10K machine prominently displayed in the center claiming that a mere 8 minute workout is the equivalent of a 40 minute workout  Alas I enjoy my gym workouts & sure don t wanna cut it short.  Food  Semi-Buffet spread at La Rotiserrie was tantalizing. The variety of chocolates displayed in a wooden chest blew us away  The whole display was feast for the eyes and exceptionally good value for money.  Love the while hotel experience and definitely will be back again

Actually I want to write an review for Le Palais Restaurant however it s not found on Trip advisor  kindly of strange as it is very famous in Taiwan.  Yummy food and good atmosphere  the Chinese food is really good especially the Dim Sum and I recommend you to take their set menu for Dinner  it s a 6 or 7 course but it s more than you need.  But the staff is really so-so especially the male staff gives us a look  that we are not going to order a lot / expensive food & look down on us    I not sure what he s thinking but he gave me a feeling of this and btw he s wearing black suit different from others  qualified as a supervisor or manager  I dont think so  he only smile after we finish ordering  please do re-consider to re-train or choose the right staff for the supervisory level of staff please Le Palais.  The girls are polite and very helpful  even escorted us to the washroom even we didn t ask them to.  Regards

Probably because the restaurant is not easy to make a reservation  I have too many expectations. Unfortunately  the quality of food and service were both poor. There was nothing good and special to dim sum and almost all dishes. Especially the desserts provided here were terrible. Tea just tasted like water in the end of our dining. Waitresses kept making mistakes about what we ordered. Dining area was too dark and not comfortable.
Overlooking Taipei  a series of small rooms invite quiet conversation with excellent food  much finished at your table.

We were seated at large round tables. All of us conference-goers on our first night in Taipei  a sort of  get together  dinner  sponsored by our hosts. The restaurant is beautifully appointed  with long passageways between discreet dining areas and delightful little alcoves with  antique  chinese furniture. The feeling is that you ve entered a wealthy person s house.  The views are spectacular and the ambient lighting allows diners to see out over the city lights  stretching far into the distance. I enjoyed the way the lighting at the tables seemed to make everyone appear individually lit - each face clear and shining - all managed from an ornate steel sculpture above the table  very effective.  Our dining room  which was large enough to accommodate some 40 of us  was acoustically perfect. It s so relaxing to know that you can hear the conversation at the table - even while there are conversations everywhere in the room - without straining or trying to block out the external din.  As for the food  Well  yes - high-quality Chinese/taiwanese fare in multiple courses - what you d expect from an expensive restaurant on the top floor of a hotel. Oddly enough though  I think i had tastier food from the night market - and at a fraction of the price  It just seemed that the food wasn t the focus of the evening. It was about ambience - about exclusivity.  The service could not have been better. Discreet  attentive and ultra-efficient - it seemed that everyone knew what to do and exactly when. Our table barely noticed the arrival of courses or their clearance. We simply had a great evening getting to know each other in this comfortable  exclusive environment.

This restaurant is part of the hotel but you wouldn t know it  The atmosphere and experience is something similar to fine dining  the decoration and space is unique with all table seeming to have their own space. The food is mix of Chinese and Taiwanese dishes of a very high standard. Own hosts selected from the menu and provided for everyone s tastes. Definately worth a visit if you are in town.
前菜では新鮮な野菜だけを食べるお皿がその後は素晴らしい北京ダックや特製スープワインはフルボディの赤ワインを頂きましたそしてデザートも甘く柔らかく大満足の夜でした
이번 대만 여행의 중점은 맛집 탐방이었습니다  그중 르팔레 식당은 가장 고대했던 곳 중 하나였구요  기대했던 만큼 서비스 맛 퀄리티까지 매우 만족 하였습니다 다음번에도 꼭 다시 한번 들르고 싶네요   그리고 종업원분들께서 사진도 찍어주시고 굳

Service de qualité et belle décoration. Le cochon de lait laqué et le caneton laqué étaient absolument excellents. Les autres plats comprenaient des ingrédients de grande qualité également mais nous étions un peu moins séduits par le goût. Les vins sont un peu chers. L’addition est à la hauteur de ce qu’on s’attend à payer dans un étoilé Michelin mais entant peut être un peu moins fan de la cuisine chinoise que française  mon impression globale était peut être un peu moins bonne   mais tout de même un excellent moment de gastronomie
広東料理 頤宮中餐廳 Le Palais はミッシュランガイド2018年台北唯一のレストランでみるからに高級食材を使用した料理を提供されました個室でしたのでゆっくりできました
現地会社の幹部の食事会に招かれての利用ですコース料理を注文されていて  それとは別に北京ダックスタイルのダック料理を頼みましたさすが三つ星です美味しいですねまた  従業員の教育もしっかりしていて  気持ちの良いサーブでした

格は上がっていますが  それはお金に見合う価値があり  ミシュランの名前に耐えることができます  テーブルは大きく  箱がなくても良い食事環境になることができます  箱はもちろんいいですが    ローストダックは美味しいだけではなく  他の料理や軽食も良い基準を持っています   テーブルでのシェフのカットショーはもっともっとです  視力と味覚の楽しさを満足させてください  しかし  私が最も賞賛されるのは  レストランとウェイターのプロ意識とサービス態度です夜にテーブルの写真を撮らなければならなかったときでさえ  主導権を握って  そして照明のために使われた装置で特別に援助されたウェイターがいました
実際に食事をしてみて世界レベルのミシュラン三ツ星ではないと思う  料理も香港🇭🇰のレストランなら必ず作ってくれるレモンチキン🍋もここではメニューにないから作れないとは⁉️  スープも香港🇭🇰の味付けと違うもの  点心はカスタード饅頭以外は全て❓の出来です  残念なミシュラン三ツ星だ

Cena China muy buena. Platos tradicionales de varias regiones. El pato lacado pekinés es una especialidad. También el pato lacado recién nacido. El menú contiene especialidades Taiwan esas.
